column4: Please help. I have a sound problem. Video and mp3 and general sound work fine, but when it comes to skype or Gizmo, the sound has problems. Whenever I make a call, the sound is like when you have 100% cpu usage and are playing an mp3 file, it has this buzzing noise. Like: "He l  l l l l oooo, Wel l  l l coooo me to Sk   y y yy  pppeee tteeesst caaall"  Same happens in Gizmo. I trid both - ALSA and OSS (no idea what

they mean though, I am a noob) and both have the same problem. When I look at the cpu usage when making a call, both programs are not using full cpu, they use very little - the normal usage. The sound is still choppy. What is going on?
skype is bs quite frankly.. but your best bet is to ask on skype forums
how do you do it in windows then?
go to disk management, right click on the disk you need and do change label
you can write udev rules to define where to mount the partition.. you can then call it whatever you like. little complicated though
thats where the filesystem will put information from bad fsck's
there is no extension.. it can be anything
unix decides what a file is by content, not extension
good question, you can combine ls, file and rm into one command that would do it
there are a bunch of ways to do it
